intro: Oryza sativa var. amaura, commonly known as the dwarf rice variety, is a short-stemmed rice plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and reduced plant height compared to other rice varieties. This variety is often used in breeding programs to improve traits such as disease resistance and yield stability. Its botanical features include narrow leaves, small panicles, and a high grain-filling capacity. Oryza sativa var. amaura is also valued for its adaptability to various soil and climatic conditions.
